name: Fountain Court - Stewart Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and we were very impressed with how clean and modern the apartment was. It was also well stocked with soap, shampoo, dish/laundry detergent, coffee, and tea unlike the other apartments we stayed in Bath and Paris. The 12 GBP/day underground parking was a challenge get into with the ultra-tiny car lift (we had a VW Golf). It does get a tad noisy at night with the pub crowd as we are only a few doors down from one but it didn't bother us. Our apartment was overlooking Young St. Close to shops and pubs/restaurants in New Town. Great apartment if you don't mind the daily 10-15 min walk to the Old Town where all the attractions are. Won't hesitate to stay there again, especially when the new tramway system is completed.
reviews.title: Modern apartment in the New Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As this hotel was rated as No2 on Trip Advisor, we had high expectations. We stayed for two nights the week commencing 2nd July. Having pre-booked parking (£8 per day) we arrived to find no clear signs for under ground parking. The staff were pleasant but not really as welcoming as I'd hoped. After discussion with the staff we drove round the back of the hotel to find the already narrow street had been partly obstructed by several domestic waste bins. As we approached the entrance to the lift we found that this was just only wide enough for our car (Seat Ibiza). Not only that but trying to maneuver the car 90 degrees with the obstructions etc was extremely time consuming and difficulty! **Please take consideration to the size of your car as we were not informed until arrival about just how narrow the car lift was**.
reviews.title: Nice apartment but noisy with unpleasant view.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a apartment on the ground floor - when we arrived in our room we were pleased with the apartment - very nicely decorated, clean and had plenty of utensils. Unfortunately we then looked out the windows to find we were looking out onto the awful domestic waste bins we'd just come across when taking our car to the lift. My partner's initial worry was garbage trucks first thing. We did request to move rooms however the staff reported that no room would be available until the following day and that the only ones that would be available would be still over looking the bins but on the upper level. We closed the curtains and chose to try and ignore it. Just to note that there was no ventilator in our bathroom, so all the steam from the shower etc just hung around for hours.
reviews.title: Excellent Accomodation, Great Location
Excellent apartment and friendly staff
reviews.text: I must say that the location in regards to being central is brilliant - in walking distance of most things! This personally made us staying at the hotel worth while.

On the first night there was an awfully loud seagull that was squarking for the whole night whilst guarding the waste bins. When that finally stopped, the garbage truck pulled by with it's raido pumping out loud music at 6am. We stayed with friends who had a room on the opposite side of the hotel overlooking the road, on the upper level. They reported that they also had trouble sleeping due to the cars driving down the cobbled street. Needless to say we were all very tired. Similarly on the second morning the garbage truck pulled up approx 5.30 with music blazing.
reviews.title: good spot just out of main tourist areas
Great location
reviews.text: Great location, great shopping & eating close by. Appartment was roomy and comforable, with good kitchen facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was on the front - Young St. Quite noisy when cars were trundling along as there are cobblestones on the road.
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.text: Double glazing would be a good idea.
reviews.title: A home away from home

reviews.text: The apartments were superb, really comfortable, well appointed and in a great location for visiting the city sites.It has really set the bar for future city stays. The only downside was the car park was unavailable which meant a 15 min transfer to another location. Edinburgh is plagued by the tram works the whole length of Princes Street. Rose Street and George Street (5 mins walk away) are great for shops and restaurants.
reviews.title: Does exactly what it says on the tin, and very well too!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The apartment was more spacious than others I researched, and still one of the best values. It also had a separate (large!) bedroom, shower, a fully-equipped kitchen, microwave, washing machine,safe box ,fridge ,iron with stand , 3 heaters and free secure wireless Internet access.
reviews.title: Excellent 1 bedroom apartment in New Town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for a couple of nights over a weekend at the end of the festival. Apartment was reasonably priced and comes with a fully equiped kitchen, open plan sitting room and seperate bedroom and bathroom. It was tidy and clean and furnishings were comfortable and modern. The location is excellent, a stones throw from Princes St. They contacted us to let us know our room was ready 3 hours earlier than the official check in time which was really helpful and they let us store our bags there earlier as well.
reviews.title: Modern, clean, tidy, central - Excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative is that it is on a cobbled street so if you get an apartment on the road it is a little noisey but we sleep heavily so not a problem for us. Also to be honsest, you don't get alot of traffic down the street at night anyway!
reviews.title: Good...but beware the noise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here with my partner in September 2012. We were originally put in a room at the back of the property which was VERY noisy at night. I'm not a light sleeper...in fact I've slept through a fire alarm before. However, the noise from the bars at the back of the property was ridiculous. At 1:30am they were still emptying their glass bottles into bins, then at 7:30 a delivery truck brought their new kegs...the deliveryman was shouting and balling and the noise of the kegs in the cobbles was loud! I know this isn't the fault of the apartments, however it should be mentioned on their website. Also, the windows should be double or triple glazed. In fact our windows barely shut.
reviews.title: as good as staying with friends
Always good
reviews.text: We were moved to an apartment at the front of the building after complaining about the noise. The apartments were fantastic and very clean. The building is well located (minus the bar noise!) If you're a heavy sleeper, or if they can guarantee you an apartment at the front of the building then I'd definately recommend these apartments!

reviews.title: Pretty good but for a few annoyances
reviews.text: Fountain Court - Stewart Apartments what a treat on our stay in the UK. Here for 2 nights to see the tattoo and the old town. Of course it rained while we were waiting in queue but surely one comes prepared for this in the UK. The shopping was great, thank you as we head into our NZ summer we hit your summer sales, the gardens along the railway area were wonderful, we were not overcome with crowds but the tattoo was sold out, the fringe festival was on as well so another bonus to be enjoyed. The apartment was equipped with washers and driers if you needed to dry out and there was security inside your rooms, All in all a great place to stay in Edinburgh

reviews.title: Absolutely perfect, will definitely be back again!
reviews.text: These apartments are fab! I chose them after seeing they were 3rd on here and have not been disappointed! The location is perfect right next to Queen and Princess street perfect for shopping or drinks! The apartments are reasonably spacious, amaculatey clean, finished to a high standard and modern! All kitchen appliances etc. are provided, even tea and coffee! There was free wifi and flat screen tv with blu ray and surround sound! The parking is also really handy, but slightly tricky to manoeuvre your car into the car lift! We stayed with our 1 year old and it suited us perfectly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downsides which are very minor is we had a shower and I'd thought rooms had baths (only needed for baby) and if the windows are open it can be quite noisy in the morning with glass bin men but fine when closed window!
reviews.title: fantastic!

reviews.text: Overall would definitely recommend!!!
reviews.title: Great value
Modern in good location
reviews.text: we had a couple of nights here for a special occasion in june, i cannot find a single fault with the accomodation! It was spotless clean, modern and the service from reception booking taxis and advice on places to go was great. we will definatley return

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Two bedroom apartment situated to the west of the city,all mod cons,one on suite bedroom,bath and shower,huge living room & kitchen.Ideal location,near to bars,clubs and restaurants.Only 20 minutes walk to Princes Street and attractions.
reviews.title: Great location

aka: Fountain Court - Stewart Apartments Edinburgh, Scotland
description: Our 31 boutique style serviced apartments are located over 3 floors with lift access to all. Each apartment features an open plan living room and fully fitted kitchen including dishwasher and washing machine. All furnishings in the lounge, bedroom and bathroom are finished to an extremely high specification. Each apartment comes equipped with the latest technology, including a 37 inch HD television, blu-ray DVD player and iPod dock in the living room and a 32 inch HD TV in the bedroom, as well as free wireless broadband access, Sky sports and movie channels.
